title: We all know 5.4 sucked but...
body:

slight range increase =/= insane move speed
Slight changes in range can make all the difference. 50 range could be the difference between 1 and 2 autos on a target after Q'ing them.

Azir just simply doesn't do damage anymore. He statistically has nothing going for him and yes he does become stronger late game at the moment, though I think most champions still do far more damage.

I want to compare high ranged champions with good lane bullying/winning capabilities.

{{champion:51}} has a high range. She doesn't do that much damage early game but still pokes hard regardless with her Q. So did {{champion:268}} , but both of them have high range as well and both of their poking abilities can't be spammed or they will lose mana very quickly.

Caitlyn is generally referred to as an ADC that does very well in winning lane/bullying with high range and defense capabilities but falls off hard late game.

Azir was a mage that bullied lane well and too had escape capabilities, but he became a high threat late game especially in teamfights if everyone was bundled up together.

Caitlyn who is said to fall off late game where Azir is said to go beyond what most people can do with damage, still does more damage than Azir and would easily kill him in a duel.

By this simple comparison I think it's obvious that Azir needs more damage. Caitlyn and Azir are similar. Range, laning methods (zoning off the enemy, farming till they get items, trying to poke the enemy down for a kill), and also both having a rather similar escape ability with I think about the same cooldown if I remember. Caitlyn however is made for early game where Azir is better for late game, yet Caitlyn still is better than Azir late game and in my opinion has more carrying potential now.

Naut changes look good, I like the new enchant as well (though % Bonus HP should be available to all tanks, not just jungle).

His Q is so spammable though. It will help his early game clear times for sure.

About 60% of all his skills' DPS comes from his Q before cooldown passive (more after), plus mobility and attack speed. Fracture buff will change this, but 180 damage maxed is still not enough to make Skarner any more than his Q. It's probably the game's most overloaded skill, which helps make him downright useless once level 9 passes by. Q is the last thing Skarner needed buffed unless his buff was double-handed, such as a damage-to-monsters buff while decreasing base damage on Q, and then that would open room for realistic buffs on W and E.

Right now, however, they overloaded his CC to the point that they were forced to make him fight through his own mechanics to work through it, and this tendency on most reworks has made them all non-viable, as it's hard enough to fight your enemy as he squirms, but your own wonky mechanics makes it nigh impossible. That is what they should be trying to undo, as having a harder-to-use Udyr stun isn't very attractive.
I know +2 doesn't sound like much, but consider that the very first Dragon buff will amplify this effect.

Dragon gives bonus AD and doesn't affect base damages.  Nothing really changed (totally fine w/ it).  18/28/38/48/58 was an awkward number anyway, so the increase helps make math a lot easier.

Speaking of Evelynn (your name) I hope she gets some love, same for Nocturne and Kha.  These changes look like they'll shake up the meta.

"Huge tank jungle buffs"

Whoa, let's not get too ahead of ourselves. They reduced the health granted by the new jungle tank item a full 30%. Sure, you now get 25% bonus health scaling with it, but that's a big hit early, which is when tanks typically struggle the most. It ALSO costs 1000 gold for Bami's Cinder, making it the most expensive build component of any jungle item. 

Finally, they removed the CDR granted by the item. This is a nerf, no way around it.

The extra damage for farming is nice, but we've been saying how necessary that is for months. Sunfire passive in combat is helpful early game, but I still feel shortchanged. Riot seems afraid to give tanks any reasonable amount of combat power early game.

Edit**: the bonus health passive might apply to the item itself, granting ~437 hp total. Also brutalized for warrior is technically the most expensive build component for a jungle item, although 2 long swords are easy pickups. Item's not as bad as I thought, though, minus the lack of CDR.
